.class public auto ansi MediaTimeline extends System.Windows.Media.Animation.Timeline implements class System.Windows.Markup.IUriContext

Docs.summary: Provides a for media content.

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.Windows.Media.MediaTimeline> is a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Timeline> object which provides control over media timing in the same way that animation timeline objects control animations. For example, a <xref:System.Windows.Media.MediaTimeline> has associated <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Timeline.Duration%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Timeline.BeginTime%2A> properties can be used to specify when media begins and how long it plays. See [Animation Overview](~/docs/framework/wpf/graphics-multimedia/animation-overview.md) for more information on animation timelines.
There are two ways to associate a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Timeline> to a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MediaElement> using a <xref:System.Windows.Media.MediaTimeline>.
1. Inside of a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Storyboard>, when a <xref:System.Windows.Media.MediaTimeline> is targets a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MediaElement>, a <xref:System.Windows.Media.MediaClock> will be created and assigned to the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MediaElement>'s associated player. See [How to: Control a MediaElement by Using a Storyboard](~/docs/framework/wpf/graphics-multimedia/how-to-control-a-mediaelement-by-using-a-storyboard.md) for an example;
2. By explicitly creating a <xref:System.Windows.Media.MediaClock> from a <xref:System.Windows.Media.MediaTimeline> and assigning it to a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MediaElement>.
If the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Timeline.Duration%2A> of the <xref:System.Windows.Media.MediaTimeline> is set to `Automatic` (default), the duration of <xref:System.Windows.Media.MediaTimeline> is the natural duration of the media source. To find the natural duration of the media source programmatically, query the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MediaElement.NaturalDuration%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MediaElement>.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects (or any <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> object). For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.Clone%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType>.

Docs.summary: Makes this instance a deep copy of the specified . When copying dependency properties, this method copies resource references and data bindings (but they might no longer resolve) but not animations or their current values.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method is called by the <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.Clone%2A> method and should not be called directly from your code, except when calling the base implementation while overriding this method. To create a modifiable copy of the current object, call <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.Clone%2A> instead of calling this method directly.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.CloneCore%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType>.

Docs.param: The object to clone and freeze.
Docs.summary: Makes this instance a clone of the specified object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When copying dependency properties, this method copies resource references and data bindings (but they might no longer resolve) but not animations or their current values. Note that if these properties contain resource references or data bindings, <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.GetAsFrozen%2A> will fail when trying to freeze the object and will throw an <xref:System.InvalidOperationException>.
This method is called by the <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.GetAsFrozen%2A> method and should not be called directly from your code, except when calling the base implementation while overriding this method. To create a frozen copy of the current object, call <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.GetAsFrozen%2A> instead of calling this method directly.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.GetAsFrozenCore%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType>.
